intro: Urceola minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flower urn plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its urn-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
